<article id="post-96041" class="post-96041 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-money-financial tag-trending-rumors article-label-fiction article-label-truth" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/Article">
<div class="addthis_toolbox addthis_default_style addthis_32x32_style" addthis:url='https://www.truthorfiction.com/list-of-senior-discounts/' addthis:title='List of Senior Discounts-Truth! &#038

column2: ><strong>Email’s Long List of Senior Discounts-<span style=color: #008000
column4:
>Fiction!

Summary of eRumor:

A chain email includes a long list of businesses like restaurants, retailers and airlines that offer senior discounts most people don’t know about.

The Truth:

Many businesses offer senior discounts, but they vary by location and often change on short notice.

Some senior discounts are available only on certain days of the week, some are only available at certain times of the year, and some don’t apply to certain products.

column1: The best way for a senior to make sure they are getting every senior discount is to ask when they’re checking out, or to look on a website that allows them to search for senior discounts available in their zip code.
We won’t look at every single discount listed in this chain email. But it’s very first claim, that Wendy’s offers 10% off every menu item for people older than 55, is not true.

Some Wendy’s locations offer 10% off for people older than 55, others just offer a discounted price for drinks, and others don’t offer any discounts at all, according to the website SeniorDiscounts.com.
Most restaurants and retailers have similar policies, so this chain email’s long list of senior discounts isn’t completely wrong — but it’s not completely right, either.
And, just like the chain email claims, many airlines offer senior discounts. Southwest Airlines,
column2: locale=es_ES">American Airlines and United Airlines are among those that do. But the discounts may only apply to certain flights, or may only be valid at certain times. It’s best to check with an airline when booking your tickets.

column1: Seniors that belong to AARP may be able to get even more senior discounts on things like food, clothing, airfare and hotels. Click here for information on those discounts.
<div class="addthis_toolbox addthis_default_style addthis_32x32_style" addthis:url='https://www.truthorfiction.com/list-of-senior-discounts/' addthis:title='List of Senior Discounts-Truth! &#038

column4: and Send a copy to your senior friends and relatives.

column1: As I was waiting in line behind an older gentleman at Wendy’
column2: s recently, I heard him ask for his senior discount.

column1: The girl at the register apologized and charged him less.
When I asked the man what the discount was, he told me that seniors over age 55 gets 10% off everything on the menu, every day.

column3: age myself, I figured I might as well ask for the discount too.

column1: This incident prompted me to do some research, and I came across a list of restaurants, supermarkets, department stores, travel deals and other types of offers giving various discounts with different age requirements.
I was actually surprised to see how many there are and how some of them start at the young age of 50.
This list may not only be useful for you, but for your friends and family, too. Dunkin Donuts gives free coffee to people over 55. If you’
column2: re paying for a cup every day, you might want to start getting it for free.
